speaker: Jill
text: So, this is the dashboard that monitors our cloud instances. Each card represents a service which runs in a different region.
ipa: soʊ, ðɪs ɪz ðə ˈdæʃbɔːrd ðæt ˈmɒnɪtərz aʊər klaʊd ˈɪnstənsɪz. iːʧ kɑːrd ˌrɛprɪˈzɛnts ə ˈsɜːvɪs wɪʧ rʌnz ɪn ə ˈdɪfrənt ˈriːʤən.

speaker: Derek
text: Got it. What about the legacy scripts that I found in the bin/ folder? Are those still in use?
ipa: ɡɒt ɪt. wɒt əˈbaʊt ðə ˈlɛɡəsi skrɪpts ðæt aɪ faʊnd ɪn ðə bɪn ˈfəʊldər? ɑː ðəʊz stɪl ɪn juːs?

speaker: Jill
text: Only the ones which were updated recently. The others — which haven’t been touched in years — are scheduled for removal. There’s a migration doc which explains everything in detail.
ipa: ˈəʊnli ði wʌnz wɪʧ wɜːr ʌpˈdeɪtɪd ˈriːsəntli. ði ˈʌðəz — wɪʧ ˈhævənt bɪn tʌʧt ɪn jɪəz — ɑː ˈʃɛdjuːld fɔː rɪˈmuːvəl. ðɛəz ə maɪˈɡreɪʃən dɒk wɪʧ ɪksˈpleɪnz ˈɛvrɪθɪŋ ɪn ˈdiːteɪl.

speaker: Derek
text: Oh right, the one that links to the Terraform plan? I read through it last night.
ipa: əʊ raɪt, ðə wʌn ðæt lɪŋks tuː ðə ˈtɛrəfɔːm plæn? aɪ rɛd θruː ɪt lɑːst naɪt.

speaker: Jill
text: Perfect. You’ll also meet Rafael, who maintains most of our CI/CD pipelines. He’s the engineer whose automation scripts saved us during our last deployment crisis.
ipa: ˈpɜːfɪkt. juːl ˈɔːlsəʊ miːt ˈræfaɪəl, huː meɪnˈteɪnz məʊst əv aʊər siː-aɪ siː-diː ˈpaɪplaɪnz. hiːz ði ˌɛnʤɪˈnɪə huːz ˌɔːtəˈmeɪʃən skrɪpts seɪvd ʌs ˈdjʊərɪŋ aʊər lɑːst dɪˈplɔɪmənt ˈkraɪsɪs.

speaker: Derek
text: Impressive. And this wiki page — is it the one in which we document incident responses?
ipa: ɪmˈprɛsɪv. ənd ðɪs ˈwɪki peɪʤ — ɪz ɪt ðə wʌn ɪn wɪʧ wiː ˈdɒkjʊmənt ˈɪnsɪdənt rɪˈspɒnsɪz?

speaker: Jill
text: Exactly. It even has an example that shows how we handled the DNS outage last quarter.
ipa: ɪɡˈzæktli. ɪt ˈiːvən hæz ən ɪɡˈzɑːmpl ðæt ʃəʊz haʊ wiː ˈhændld ðə diː-ɛn-ɛs ˈaʊtɪʤ lɑːst ˈkwɔːtə.

speaker: Derek
text: I noticed a few cron jobs which run under a service account that no one seems to own.
ipa: aɪ ˈnəʊtɪst ə fjuː krɒn ʤɒbz wɪʧ rʌn ˈʌndər ə ˈsɜːvɪs əˈkaʊnt ðæt nəʊ wʌn siːmz tuː əʊn.

speaker: Jill
text: Yeah, those belong to an internal tool which was deprecated last year. We’ll probably remove the entire bucket in which its data is still being stored.
ipa: jæ, ðəʊz bɪˈlɒŋ tuː ən ɪnˈtɜːnəl tuːl wɪʧ wəz ˈdɛprəkeɪtɪd lɑːst jɪə. wiːl ˈprɒbəbli rɪˈmuːv ði ɪnˈtaɪə ˈbʌkɪt ɪn wɪʧ ɪts ˈdeɪtə ɪz stɪl ˈbiːɪŋ stɔːd.

speaker: Derek
text: Thanks for the context. It’s great to be joining a team that actually cares about maintainability.
ipa: θæŋks fɔː ðə ˈkɒntɛkst. ɪts ɡreɪt tuː biː ˈʤɔɪnɪŋ ə tiːm ðæt ˈækʧuəli keəz əˈbaʊt meɪnˌteɪnəˈbɪlɪti.

speaker: Jill
text: And we’re happy to have someone who asks the right questions.
ipa: ənd wɪə ˈhæpi tuː hæv ˈsʌmwʌn huː ɑːsks ðə raɪt ˈkwɛsʧənz.
